page.title: 12RECREATION-MODELS
page.content:
** MODELLING IN BLINDCRAKE IN 1985 **
Traditional modelling materials eg wood and metal have now been largely superceeded by plastic in its many forms. Several people in the village make model aeroplanes with Balsa wood construction but fibreglass fuselages and foam polystyrene wings covered in veneer are much quicker to build at about the same cost. Most models are Radio Controlled. Plastic static models are popular as are model railways. Trains are made from white metal or etched brass kits. The greatest difficulty in modelling here is the long distance needed to travel to obtain kits or materials. Using the post is often quicker and cheaper!
